name: Isengrim's Council

fluff: Hunting on Mahakam's craggy cliffs is not particularly easy… but nor are dwarves particularly put off by danger.

fluff: Knew a young couple once—got separated right after the weddin'. Bomb in the carriage'll do that.

fluff: Dryads wield a mystifying power to shape the forest's trees into any form they wish. So why not a giant boar?
name: Treant Boar

tooltip.value: If on turn end you control 5 or more allied Elf units,
this unit from your deck to the melee row.

fluff: Better to die standing than to live on bent knee.
name: Aelirenn

tooltip.value: : Damage an enemy unit by the number of Elf units in this row.

fluff: We are the drops of rain that together make a ferocious storm.
name: Yaevinn

tooltip.value: an Elven Deadeye into this row.

fluff: Hated by men, reviled by elves and always picked last during schoolyard games. No wonder half-elves tend to have a chip on their shoulder.
name: Half-Elf Hunter

tooltip.value: : Damage an enemy unit by the number of cards to the left of Great Oak, then boost self by the number of cards to the right of Great Oak.

fluff: The trees of Brokilon oft rustle amongst themselves, despairing of the ancient oak whose heart now rots with hatred.
name: The Great Oak

tooltip.value: : Damage an enemy unit by 1, then give it

fluff: I do not live in the forest of Brokilon. I am a part of it.
name: Dryad Ranger

fluff: The dryads of Brokilon mastered a unique craft – to shape trees at will... And breathe into them life.
name: Forest Whisperer

fluff: Its name misleads, for 'tis not the tree who weeps.
name: Weeping Willow

tooltip.value: ): Each allied Elven Deadeye damages a random enemy unit by 2.

fluff: It turns out that the forest isn't inhabited by, to quote the captain of the guard, "some furry fucking thing", but Scoia'tael commandos. They were led by someone named Vernossiel…
name: Vernossiel

tooltip.value: a base copy of self in this row.

fluff: They especially like to chew on fingers, which to them are just like juicy carrots.
name: Oakcritters

tooltip.value: : Transform self into a Young Dryad without changing power.

fluff: People believe that sick girls will spread their illness among the dryads, but in reality, Brokilon protects its children. Abandoned ones, too.
name: Abandoned Girl

tooltip.value: a Young Dryad in this row.
At the start of round, while in hand or deck, transform.

fluff: She used to instruct her Dryads to warn people two or even three times before shooting with lethal intention. Used to anyhow.
name: Eithne Young Queen

tooltip.value: Damage a unit by 6. Decrease the damage by 1 for each unit adjacent to it.

fluff: Assassin — one of the most popular professions at the imperial court, just after scribe and courtesan.
name: Assassination

tooltip.value: Play the lowest unit from your deck.

fluff: We are but pawns in a game played by old men, sent to fight and die on their senile whims…
name: Marching Orders

tooltip.value: a random card in your deck. If it's a unit, boost self by its power and shuffle it back. If it's an artifact or a special card, play it.

fluff: Astrology, hydromancy, haruspicy, ceromancy. Ovomancy, spodomancy, metroscopy, brontoscopy…
name: Xarthisius

tooltip.value: a random unit from your deck, then boost an allied unit by its power.

fluff: Yes, I have seen the future. And you're not in it.
name: Yennefer: Divination

tooltip.value: the top unit from your opponent's deck and damage self by its power, then shuffle it back.

fluff: The most powerful of Nilfgaard's mages have mastered the art of creating golems. On a few occasions, they've even managed to make them fight for the imperial cause…
name: Imperial Golem

tooltip.value: all copies of this unit from your deck to this row.

fluff: The Impera Brigade never surrenders. Ever.
name: Impera Brigade

tooltip.value: the top unit from their deck to a random enemy row.

fluff: Tibor's zeal was legendary. It was said when the emperor passed, he'd not so much bow as somersault.
name: Tibor Eggebracht

tooltip.value: a random unit from your deck and damage an enemy unit by its power.

fluff: I can take care of myself. Trust me.
name: Triss Merigold

tooltip.value: ): Destroy an enemy unit, then your opponent
the top unit from their deck to a random enemy row.
the top unit from your deck to a random allied row.

fluff: We are all pawns on his board. Playing a game whose rules we do not know.
name: Vilgefortz

tooltip.value: Play a Bronze unit from your opponent's graveyard.

fluff: Well... At least, I can't make you more dead...
name: Experimental Remedy

tooltip.value: : If your starting deck does not have cards with provision cost 10 or more, gain

fluff: Zireael possesses a great power she cannot control. She is a danger - to herself, to others. Until she learns to control it, she should remain isolated.
name: Ciri: Nova

tooltip.value: ): Play a Tactic card from your deck.

fluff: I'll take an attentive reconnaissance unit over a fine brigade any day.
name: Menno Coehoorn

tooltip.value: and play a bronze card from your opponent's faction.

fluff: A spy? No, that's saying far too much. I consider myself more of an observer.
name: Imperial Diplomacy

tooltip.value: : Boost self by 1 for each Tactic in your hand.

fluff: Ebbing is famed for its top-notch mercenaries and light cavalry.
name: Venendal Elite

tooltip.value: and play a 1-power copy of a bronze unit from your starting deck.

fluff: It is said he created an illusion so realistic that he began to believe it himself...
name: Artorius Vigo

tooltip.value: Boost an allied unit by 3 and give it 2
If it's a Soldier, boost it by 5 and give it 2

fluff: Many a knight met an untimely death because of his shoddily tied breastplate coming undone.
name: Battle Preparation

tooltip.value: Look at the first 3 cards on the top of your deck and play one of them.

fluff: Nilfgaardians fight every battle twice: first on the map, then in reality.
name: War Council

tooltip.value: an enemy unit with 3 power or less.

fluff: You did what to who? To be fair, I can’t even recall the specifics anymore.
name: Amnesty
